name: Inn at Ellis River

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Hosts at the Inn at Ellis River and their entire staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The attention to detail among which were our delicious breakfasts, afternoon snacks, our cozy room, and comfortable bed was exceptional. The sounds and view of the Ellis River from the Inn was an added relaxing pleasure.
reviews.title: Scenic Beauty, Fabulous Food, Delightful Hosts, Great Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn at Ellis River was one of the nicest B & B ‘s we have ever stayed at.
reviews.title: Most wonderful place in the world!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn at Ellis River is a welcome respite from every day life, and well worth the 8+ hour drive from Long Island! The Innkeepers are amazing in every way, from the thoughtful details throughout to the fabulous breakfasts and afternoon snacks, and our room was simply beautiful. (We stayed in the Paradise Falls room -- love the balcony access to listen to the river, the fireplace, and the jacuzzi!) Our trip was for our second honeymoon, and we will most certainly go back as soon as we can! There is easy access to lots of outdoor activities and to dining & shopping, but there really is not a lot of reason to ever leave once you arrive. They offer a wide variety of packages (which made our trip even more affordable) and are willing to help you put together your ideal time away. Whether for a weekend getaway or a longer celebration/vacation, we can think of no other place in New Hampshire we would rather be. We highly, highly, highly recommend the Inn at Ellis River -- and hope that you have as wonderful a time as we did.
reviews.title: Beyond your Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay. And it was more than we remembered. Lyn Frank And Christine treat you better than Family! The Gourmet Breakfast will send you out on you day extremely satisfied and full. The afternoon goodies will give you that sweet fix you need to get you through to dinner. The packages they offer are well worth taking. We took the romance package. The Massage was great. The dinner for 2 at the Cider House was Incredible. You can not go wrong staying here. If you hear a bad review it is a LIE!! Thanks for the great Anniversary!!
reviews.title: A destination in itself

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highest accolades to this B&B. From start to finish a memorable experience. This inn is everything it claims to be and more. We have stayed at a few B&B's but none compare to the service, impeccable cleanliness, and meticulous attention to detail received here. We were offered assistance with our bags at check in. Breakfast had a reserved seating time so you could be personally served (by the owner and staff) and offered a choice of two hot delicious items that were prepared fresh upon ordering. Frank and his wife apologized to us for not being at the desk when we checked in to personally greet us. The owners and the staff went out of their way to anticipate and fulfill all needs and ensure a wonderful stay. You could write paragraphs regarding the inn and the service received. Quiet, relaxation, beautiful surroundings, walking proximity to a fine restaurant, fun staff, heated pool, hot tub to soak in after a long day's hike, and wonderfully appointed rooms with comfortable beds make this a Must Return. Our biggest disappointment was we only booked for one night! (return trip from Maine to PA with a stopover over to enjoy Mt. Washington).
reviews.title: Best Vacation Spot Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had an absolutely wonderful time at the Inn. The owners Lyn and Frank, along with the Inn keeper, Christine, were extremely accomodating and served up a wonderful breakfast. They have a beautiful house with more things to do than most hotels along with very comfortable rooms. The scenery out the back window is unbelievable! I shopped around before staying here and found this Inn to have more to do at a better price than thier local competitors. If we are ever back in N.H. this will be my first choice of stays.
reviews.title: Perfect!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent place to stay. The innkeepers are quite attentive and friendly. The room we stayed in was very nice and well furnished. One thing that stands out about the inn and adds to the experience is the amount of common space. There is a bar area with darts, games, and books, there is a breakfast area, there is a nice sitting area with more games, there is a room with a jacuzzi, and a gazebo outside overlooking a river. This makes a big difference when you are back at the inn and want something to do. The breakfasts were also great. The inn is centrally located in the town Jackson, with good dining options nearby but not overdeveloped. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lyn, Frank and the staff have mastered the art of Inn-keeping at the Inn at Ellis River. The rooms are exquisite, the breakfasts are fantastic, and the overall cozy atmosphere is enough to make you never want to leave. Nothing has been left out to make your stay the ultimate in romance and relaxation. And the afternoon cookies are to die for! Make it a point to travel up to Jackson and visit. Make sure you put it on your "Bucket List"!
reviews.title: You MUST experience this Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My self, my wife and 2.5 year old child booked a stay at the Ellis River Inn online. Upon arrival in the area we hiked all day and in the evening arrived to check in to the Inn. It is then that we found out that they have a policy prohibiting children under 12. It was distressing enough to find out that a family not be allowed to enjoy a nice place to stay together, but the way that it was handled also screamed poor service. After not allowing us to stay, they wanted to charge us a cancelled reservation fee to boot!
reviews.title: Family Discriminitory Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It does say on their website, at the bottom of the page, buried in other text that the inn "is appropriate for guests 12 years and up." However, there is a button at the top of the page that begins the reservation process, through which this discriminitory policy is never mentioned. Living in America, I never dreamed that any paying customer may not be welcome, so I did not scour the site for such a policy. I typically make it a point to stay at B&B's wherever I travel all over the world. In the future, I won't be staying at this Inn, with or without my children.
reviews.title: I have used this hotel three times in the pass few months.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned for another New Year’s holiday and enjoyed our stay as much as the first time. I was pleased that it was just as we remembered and it was even better as they had made a few updates to the Inn since our last stay. I strongly recommend that you reserve a minimum of 3 nights – our 2 night stay was too short and we were just getting to relax when we had to pack up as there were no rooms available to extend our stay. We are hopefully returning again soon before next New Years!
reviews.title: Just as we remembered - Another Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights over New Years. Frank, Lynn, and staff know what their clientes want in an inn, and provide it. Clean rooms, friendly staff, great breakfasts, all adding up to a great experience.
reviews.title: Dittos on the great reviews. This Inn knows their business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful getaway!! It had been so long since my husband and I had ben able to really relax and enjoy each other that we had almost forgotten what we had, wondering what we might still have. And finally, there we were sitting by a fire with the sound of the river outside the cottage beckoning us to recall - - - - each other. We looked through the books left there for guests to write in and they certainly did write. They wrote about the Inn, the innkeepers, the staff; they wrote with suggestions of where to go and what to do; they wrote about themselves and even to each other. We thought about the people who had stayed here on their honeymoon, anniversary, as a new baby celebration, just to get away, and then there were people like us trying to rekindle an old fire. . . .
reviews.title: Our recent stay at the Inn at Ellis River was one we will never forget.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We can only describe the inn as peaceful and tranquil with so much opportunity to relax. Breakfast was delicious and satisfying, our room was kept clean, the staff was friendly and the innkeepers were so helpful and accomodating to all our needs. I have to believe Lin and Frank must be true romantics to have created such an atmosphere, such a place.
reviews.title: Lovely Inn, Great Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009
reviews.text: And here we are, my husband and I together, still. We loved the little cottage and wonder only now whether we will stay there again next year or visit a diferent room at the Inn at Ellis River.
reviews.title: Cozy old world charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here during our recent vacation and found the experience to be utterly delightful. The staff are wonderful and helpful to an extreme,. The rooms are a bit on the small side but impeccably clean, charming and each with their own character. (Due to unexpected circumstances on our part, we ended up staying in two separate rooms during our stay. Loved them both.) Breakfast was always excellent. I would recommend this inn to anyone visiting in the area, and should we find ourselves back there, we will certainly visit again.
reviews.title: a true gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights on our recent trip to New England for the fall. It is a lovely Inn in a beautiful location. We stayed in the Pearl Cascade which was a beautiful room with the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in and a jacuzzi for 2 that was so relaxing after a day's walking & hiking. It has lovely views of the Ellis river from the balcony.
reviews.title: A lovely Inn in a beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The afternoon cake & cookies were all freshly baked & very scrummy & the breakfast really set you up for the day.
reviews.title: Nice B&B good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Frank, Lyn & Christine were wonderful hosts and made you feel so welcome. We would recommend you stay here without any hesitation.
reviews.title: if only we had stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights , never stayed in a B&B before.Clean , good food , nice people, nice room .
reviews.title: A cozy and relaxing Inn with accommodating hosts and friendly staff.

aka: Inn At Ellis River Hotel Jackson
description: In the quaint town of Jackson, Inn at Ellis River offers exquisite lodging for NH White Mountains. Whether celebrating a special occasion or looking for the perfect vacation getaway, our inn offers ideal accommodations. We offer standard rooms and suites, most with fireplaces, many with Jacuzzis and balconies. Each room has a view of the pool or the picturesque mountains near the inn. Enjoy the nearby waterfalls, trout streams and hiking trails to Mt. Washington. Reserve today!
